title: Background
text: following formalism taken [1]. Define D={Y,X}D = \{Y,X\} n×mn \times m data matrix consisting n×m−1n \times m-1 predictor (XX) n×1n \times 1 target (YY) variables. Note authors consider DD tuple [2]. Also define MM n×mn \times m missingness indicator matrix. element 11 00 corresponding observed missing values DD respectively. Finally, define DobsD_{obs} DmisD_{mis} observed missing portions DD. way, DD can loosely partitioned D={Dobs,Dmis}D = \{D_{obs}, D_{mis}\}. definitions MCAR, MAR, MNAR based probability distribution MM. P(M|D)=P(M)P(M|D) = P(M) P(M|D)=P(M|Dobs)P(M|D) = P(M|D_{obs}) P(M|D)=P(M|D)P(M|D) = P(M|D) summarised informally [1].

text: goal missr help classify missing data MCAR, MAR, MNAR. providing: - Statistical tests MCAR MAR: - mcar() - mar() - Process elimination MNAR: - mnar()

title: Classify Missing Data As MCAR, MAR, or MNAR
text: Null hypothesis data MCAR; p-value significant, evidence data MCAR. null hypothesis data MAR; p-value significant, evidence data MAR. new tests, simply process elimination.

text: following, column M missing data regressed D_obs. regression produces vector p-values (one variable D_obs). smallest p-value important. missing data need dependent one observed variable data MAR. reported smallest p-value significant, data MAR. See vignette("background") definitions M D_obs.
